intro: Trichomanes acutilobum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed maidenhair fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Hymenophyllaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that are typically light green in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds in specialized structures called sorus. Trichomanes acutilobum is known for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in shaded garden settings.
